__e: No, don't tell her I love her. Tell her to go home and forget me.
Well, if you do, tell him to go to hell.
Tell him to take the woman and go tonight.
Tell him not go, at least not today, there's lots to see.
I need help to get the job done.
Tell him it's not death I fear but looking behind me and not finding her face.
And tell him, thanks to you, I know what I have to do now.
Well, tell him that I'm still here and that I'm not leaving until he lets me in.
─ Yes? Will you say that all those things I said to her. I realize now were not true.
just i will be off in a few minutes I want to thank you for everything.
- If you'd just let the people know tomorrow you're in favour of us.
Please tell the folks at home what's going through your mind right now.
So, please go back and tell your boss that...
Nice try, detective, but tell your boss I'm not buying anything he's selling.
Tell this man to his face what you told me.
my family shouldn't be cross with me for being away so much of course they won't be cross.
Yes, I'd like you to tell Mr. Smith that Mr. Jones needs to contact him... right away.
I'd like to talk to Mr. Jordan.
You just tell Mr. Charles I'm here, that's all.
Ah, well. Please to convey my regrets to the captain. Yes, sir.
- Tell the captain I want to speak to him.
Tell the captain to inform me the moment he's found her, and to hurry.
Please tell the father of the child about this.
tell the marshal I want to see him, Montrose.
Please, tell the president that I have a daughter too.
You can tell that to your wife and three kids.
Next time you cozy up to your pal in the sky, you tell him that.
But I have enough for two--tell him that.
Tell him what I want, but not here.
Just tell him what you told me.
Tell him what happened to you, what these people are capable of.
Just tell him what you told me.
If he contacts you, tell him that and ask him to call me at once.
Tell him what happened to you, what these people are capable of.
